headline.seo: Emilio Renteria Suspended for Head Butt

docs.snippet: Major League Soccer suspended Columbus Crew forward Emilio Renteria for one game for his head butt of Sporting Kansas City’s Paulo Nagamura on Saturday....
docs.abstract: Major League Soccer suspends Columbus Crew forward Emilio Renteria for one game and imposes a fine for head butting Sporting Kansas City midfielder Paulo Nagamura during match that Kansas City won, 2-0.
docs.lead_paragraph: Major League Soccer suspended Columbus Crew forward Emilio Renteria for one game for his head butt of Sporting Kansas City’s Paulo Nagamura on Saturday.

docs.snippet: Kelly Hardwick, who filed a discrimination lawsuit against the United States women’s national coach, the N.B.A. and USA Basketball, will be on a security detail at the London Games, the N.B.A. said....
docs.abstract: Kelly Hardwick, NBA security official who filed a discrimination lawsuit against the United States women’s national coach Geno Auriemma, the NBA and USA Basketball, will be on a security detail at the 2012 Olympics; Hardwick claims Auriemma tried to kiss her on a trip to Russia in 2009.
docs.lead_paragraph: Kelly Hardwick, who filed a discrimination lawsuit against the United States women’s national coach, the N.B.A. and USA Basketball, will be on a security detail at the London Games, the N.B.A. said.

docs.snippet: The Nets continued their off-season run of signings, agreeing to a two-year deal with forward Kris Humphries, who averaged 13.8 points and 11 rebounds for the team last season....
docs.abstract: Brooklyn Nets re-sign forward Kris Humphries to a two-year contract worth $24 million.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Nets continued their off-season run of signings, agreeing to a two-year deal with forward Kris Humphries, who averaged 13.8 points and 11 rebounds for the team last season.

docs.snippet: Voluntary physical inactivity, a practice once confined mostly to North America and parts of Europe, is spreading rapidly to the rest of the world and likely contributing materially to global gains in tonnage and declines in health, a group of gro...
docs.abstract: Voluntary physical inactivity, a practice once confined mostly to North America and parts of Europe, is spreading rapidly to the rest of the world and likely contributing materially to global gains in tonnage and declines in health, a group of groundbreaking new reports suggests.
